title.narrative: 2014 H&N IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2016, government structures and leadership and emergency response capacities are strengthened., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 2 / Health&Nutrition: By 2018, children and women benefit from prevention of chronic malnutrition through an integrated health and nutrition package, maternal and neonatal health and child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, government structures and leadership and emergency response capacities are strengthened.

description.narrative: Only cholera outbreak was recorded in 2018 with at least 102 cases treated and Burundi remain on high alert for ebola. UNICEF supported emergency preparedness and response, acted as nutrition sector lead and health sector co-lead, and supported the Scale-Up Nutrition movement, a national nutrition survey and nutrition strategy development. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: % of government-declared emergencies supported by UNICEF
Percentage of outbreaks that are detected and responded to within 72 hours
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Children aged 6-59 months with SAM targetted by UNICEF-support (financial or supplies) who are admitted in humanitarian situations
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Children 6-59 months in affected areas who have been screened for acute malnutrition per screening period
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to public health emergencies in place
